name: 'Presumed Innocent' the book Quiz | Authors | 10 Questions

questions.text: Rusty Sabich is the central character of 'Presumed Innocent': who narrates the novel?
questions.explanation:
Rusty Sabich.

	Rusty Sabich (real name Rozat Sabich) is the chief deputy PA, the novel's central character and also narrates the story. Raymond Horgan is Rusty's {boss;} Dan Lipranzer is a policeman who is Rusty's best {friend;} Carolyn Polhemus is the lawyer whose death provides the novel's story.

Nat.

	He is called Nat, short for Nathanial. He provides rare moments of peace and innocence in the book.

questions.text: What subject does Barbara study at the university?
questions.explanation:
Mathematics.

	She is studying theoretical mathematics at University which means time spent working on the mainframe there.

questions.text: What is the name of the gang that Rusty helped break up years before the novel begins?
questions.explanation:
Night Saints.

	The Night Saints, led by an ex-con under the name of Harrukan ran drugs, crime and social activity in the Grace Street projects.

questions.text: What is the name of the colour of carpet fibres found in Carolyn's apartment?
questions.explanation:
Scottish Malt.

	Scottish Malt is the name. It is a very common colour of carpet, which the Sabich's also have....

questions.text: What cartoon character does Rusty's son have as a poster in his bedroom?
questions.explanation:
Spiderman.

	Judge Dredd might seem appropriate but the answer is Spiderman.

questions.text: What is the nickname of the pathologist, Dr Kumagai, whose evidence provides one of the turning points of the novel?
questions.explanation:
Painless.

	He is nicknamed Painless supposedly because the only person who finds it painless working with him is the (dead) patient....

questions.text: What was the nature of the case that brought Rusty and Carolyn together?
questions.explanation:
child abuse.

	It was a child abuse case: Wendell McGuffag who had been tortured by his mother.

questions.text: What is the name of the suburb where Rusty lives?
questions.explanation:
Nearing.

	His being sighted at the bus station in Nearing is one of the witness statements in the novel.

questions.text: In which city does the author Scott Turow practice law?
questions.explanation:
Chicago.

	He is still a lawyer not primarily a novelist
